question: Can I bring my own lunch to campus, and are there microwaves?
expected_answer: Yes, students can bring their own lunch. Microwaves are available on all floors of the UNH Manchester building.
retrieval_context: Ans: Yes, you can bring your own lunch. Microwaves are available on all floors of the building.

question: Does UNH Manchester have a gym?
expected_answer: No, but students can get discounted memberships at the YMCA.
retrieval_context: Ans: UNH Manchester does not have a sports facility or a gym. The YMCA offers a membership discount to UNH students (https://manchester.unh.edu/student-experience/wildcats-at-the-ymca).

question: How do I connect to Wi-Fi on campus?
expected_answer: Connect to the “eduroam” network using your UNH credentials.
retrieval_context: Ans: To access the university Wi-Fi, turn on your Wi-Fi and look for the network named 'eduroam'. Click on it and log in using your UNH login credentials.

question: Is student health insurance mandatory?
expected_answer: Yes, all F-1 international students must enroll in UNH’s Student Health Benefits Plan (SHBP).
retrieval_context: UNH policy requires all F-1 students to purchase health insurance through UNH. Medical care is very expensive in the United States, and this requirement is for your own protection.

question: What are the transportation options from Logan Airport to UNH Manchester?
expected_answer: Boston Express (Concord Coach Lines) travels regularly to Manchester. The fare is about $25.
retrieval_context: Ans: The Boston Express Bus (Concord Coach Lines) travels from Logan Airport to New Hampshire regularly. The fare is about $25. From the bus stop, you can take an Uber or Lyft to your destination.

question: When does orientation begin?
expected_answer: Orientation begins on Monday, August 18, 2025, at 12:30 PM EST.
retrieval_context: Orientation is a crucial part of your transition to our university. It begins on Monday, August 18, 2025, at 12:30pm EST, and ends on Friday, August 22, 2025.

question: Is orientation in person or virtual?
expected_answer: Orientation is in person. Attendance is mandatory.
retrieval_context: Ans: In-person attendance is mandatory for orientation. You must plan your travel accordingly to attend orientation beginning on August 18, 2025.

question: Where can I find faculty information for the MS in Cybersecurity Engineering program?
expected_answer: Go to https://manchester.unh.edu/program/ms/cybersecurity-engineering, scroll down to “Explore Program Details,” and click on “Faculty Directory.”
retrieval_context: Faculty for Cybersecurity: https://manchester.unh.edu/program/ms/cybersecurity-engineering — Scroll down to Explore Program Details → click on Faculty Directory

question: Does UNH Manchester provide on-campus housing?
expected_answer: No. Students typically rent apartments near campus or along bus routes.
retrieval_context: UNH Manchester students typically rent apartments within walking distance of campus or near a bus route, as on-campus housing is not available.

question: How are you doing today, chatbot?
expected_answer: I'm well and ready to assist—what can I do for you?
retrieval_context: This is a general conversational greeting directed to the chatbot. It does not require specific retrieval from university documents.

question: Thank you!
expected_answer: You're welcome! Let me know if you have any more questions.
retrieval_context: This is a polite closing or appreciation phrase and does not require specific retrieval.

question: Can you help me with course registration?
expected_answer: Yes! For Cybersecurity and IT programs, the department usually registers students before orientation. You can check your UNH email for updates.
retrieval_context: Students in the Cybersecurity Engineering and IT degree programs are usually registered for their first semester classes by their department shortly before orientation.

question: What should I bring for the first day of orientation?
expected_answer: You must bring a laptop computer. Cell phones or tablets may not be sufficient.
retrieval_context: A laptop computer will be needed for the first day of orientation and for the duration of your degree program, a cell phone or a tablet/iPad will work for many situations, but not everything.

question: Can I visit campus before orientation?
expected_answer: No, students are asked not to visit campus before the designated orientation time on August 18, 2025.
retrieval_context: We kindly ask students to refrain from visiting campus before the designated orientation time on Monday, August 18, 2025, as we are unable to accommodate drop-in visitors.
